</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	*
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill joined the Company as its Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer, Secretary and Treasurer on November&nbsp;9, 2015.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Annual Cash Incentive Compensation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The fiscal year 2016 Cash Incentive Plan provides annual cash incentive compensation opportunities based on the Company&#146;s financial
	performance as well as individual performance.&nbsp;The Cash Incentive Plan is weighted based on the following factors: (i) 80% on three performance measures related to our financial performance (each such measure described below), and (ii) 20%
	based on individual performance measured through a subjective assessment of performance of the NEO as compared to their annual
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	81
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage84"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297977D10KA_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	performance objectives as well as demonstrated leadership. By tying a significant portion of the executive&#146;s total annual cash compensation to annual variable pay, the Committee believes it
	further reinforces our pay for performance culture and focuses our executives on critical short-term financial and operational objectives, which also support our long-term financial goals.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Establishing Target Payouts
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the
	Cash Incentive Plan, target payouts for each NEO are reviewed on an annual basis and compared against the compensation peer group. The Chief Executive Officer, with input from the human resources department, proposes annual target payout
	adjustments, if any, for all NEOs, excluding himself, based on the aforementioned performance measures. His proposal is subject to review and approval (with or without modifications) by the Committee. Changes to Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty&#146;s targeted
	payout from the Cash Incentive Plan are initiated and approved by the Committee directly, subject to the review and final approval of our board of directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Consistent with our compensation principles, the target payouts from the Cash Incentive Program are a significant portion of the target annual
	cash compensation for our NEOs. The Committee believes the established targets enhance the alignment to our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pay-for-performance
</FONT>
</FONT>
	and stakeholder alignment principles. The
	target annual cash incentive payouts for fiscal year 2016 as a percentage of salary were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Performance Measures
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Committee believes that the following measures reflect key value drivers for purposes of establishing payouts under the Cash Incentive
	Plan:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A
<I>
	djusted EBITDA
</I>
	&#151; EBITDA before stock based compensation expense,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	charges and certain other expenses.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Total Net Sales
</I>
	&#151;&nbsp;sales after cash discounts, product returns, and freight rebills.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Average Quarterly Debt Balance
</I>
	&#151;&nbsp;average quarter end long-term debt.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Individual Goal Achievement
</I>
	&#151;&nbsp;performance of the executives versus their annual performance objectives and demonstrated leadership.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For fiscal year 2016, our Cash Incentive Plan was heavily weighted to profitability and sales performance.&nbsp;Accordingly, 55% of the
	incentive award was based upon the achievement of certain levels of adjusted EBITDA, 15% was based upon certain levels of Total Net Sales, and 10% was based upon certain levels of&nbsp;average quarterly debt.&nbsp;20% of the Plan was based upon
	attainment of certain individual performance objectives and demonstrated leadership.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Performance Thresholds
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As reflected in the table below, minimum, target, and maximum performance thresholds were established based on the Committee&#146;s assessment
	of performance targets that appropriately drive and reward the achievement of growth versus our prior year performance levels.&nbsp;The thresholds established for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-individual
</FONT>
	metrics in the Cash
	Incentive Plan for fiscal year 2016 were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	minimum performance thresholds, which earn a 50% payout, were set at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-restated
</FONT>
	fiscal year 2015 performance levels;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	target performance thresholds, which earn a 100% payout, were set at levels to achieve 15% and 31%, growth versus the prior year for Total Net Sales and Adjusted EBITDA, respectively, and a 14% reduction in Average
	Quarterly Debt versus the prior year; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	82

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	maximum performance thresholds, which earn a 250% payout, were set at levels to achieve 29% and 61% growth versus the prior year for Total Net Sales and Adjusted EBITDA, respectively, and a 27% reduction in Average
	Quarterly Debt versus the prior year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Payout percentages for performance between the minimum and maximum performance
	thresholds for each of these financial metrics is determined by using linear interpolation.&nbsp;Actual performance results used in determining payout award percentages for each of the three financial metrics were based upon the Company&#146;s
	fiscal year 2016 unaudited results announced on June&nbsp;7, 2016.&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA and Total Net Sales amounts were further adjusted in connection with the completion of the fiscal year 2016 audit, which amounts as adjusted are further
	described above in &#147;Item 6. Selected Financial and Operating Data.&#148;&nbsp;The performance goals and performance results utilized by the Committee in making payout awards for fiscal year 2016 (dollars in millions) for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-individual
</FONT>
	metrics in the plan were as follows:

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	*
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Amounts used for purposes of determining payout percentages were based upon the Company&#146;s fiscal year 2016 unaudited results announced on June
</I>
<I>
</I>
<I>
	&nbsp;7, 2016.
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Cash Incentive Plan also includes an individual goal achievement measure, weighted at 20% of the plan, to provide the Chief Executive
	Officer, the Committee, and our board of directors the opportunity to distinguish individual performance.&nbsp;Payout percentages ranging from 0%&nbsp;-&nbsp;250%, identical to the range for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-individual
</FONT>
	metrics in the plan, can be awarded to each participant to allow for differentiation based on each NEO&#146;s performance versus individual goals and their demonstrated leadership.&nbsp;Payout percentages for this metric are awarded following an
	assessment of each NEO&#146;s performance versus their individual objectives established for fiscal year 2016 as well as a subjective evaluation of their demonstrated leadership throughout the year in driving achievement of their individual and the
	Company&#146;s overall objectives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The annual performance objectives for Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty for fiscal year 2016 included (i)&nbsp;leading
	the achievement of revenue and earnings targets, (ii)&nbsp;leading the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-going
</FONT>
	development of the senior management development and succession plan, (iii)&nbsp;driving new product development initiatives,
	(iv)&nbsp;delivering the targeted performance levels for the Ideal Pipe acquisition, (v)&nbsp;developing with the Board a capital return strategy, (vi)&nbsp;updating the long-term strategic plan, and (vii)&nbsp;expanding presence with company
	outside stakeholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The annual performance objectives for Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill for fiscal year 2016 included (i)&nbsp;completing the
	fiscal year 2015 audit and restatement, (ii)&nbsp;driving Sarbanes Oxley compliance, (iii)&nbsp;implementing the financial reorganization plan, (iv)&nbsp;participating in the updating of the long-term strategic plan, (v)&nbsp;completing the fiscal
	year 2017 operating budget, and (vi)&nbsp;building relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The annual performance
	objectives for Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon for fiscal year 2016 included (i)&nbsp;completing all fiscal year 2016 quarterly and annual filings, (ii)&nbsp;developing and implementing an effective investor relations program, (iii)&nbsp;working with the Audit
	Committee to complete fiscal year 2016 audit, (iv)&nbsp;driving Sarbanes Oxley compliance, (v)&nbsp;updating the long-term strategic plan, and (vi)&nbsp;building relationships with equity analysts, and (vii)&nbsp;building leadership and talent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The annual performance objectives for Mr.&nbsp;Fussner for fiscal year 2016 included (i)&nbsp;delivering the targeted performance levels for
	the Ideal Pipe acquisition, (ii)driving achievement of planned conversion costs (iii)&nbsp;leading the achievement of planned freight and logistics performance levels, (iv)&nbsp;driving targeted improvement from pipe quality initiatives,
	(v)&nbsp;driving improvement in HP pipe production performance, (vi)&nbsp;leading the improved performance of Green Line Polymers, (vii)&nbsp;achieving the planned
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-ups
</FONT>
	for new and relocated production
	lines, and (viii)&nbsp;building leadership and talent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The annual performance objectives for Mr.&nbsp;Vitarelli for fiscal year 2016
	included (i)&nbsp;driving achievement of planned sales revenue in the U.S. and Canada, (ii)&nbsp;driving pipe new product development initiatives, (iii)&nbsp;leading water quality new product development initiatives, (iv)&nbsp;leading the
	implementation of initiatives from the resin task force, and (v)&nbsp;building leadership and talent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	83
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage86"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297977D10KA_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The annual performance objectives for Mr.&nbsp;Klein for fiscal year 2016
	included(i)&nbsp;driving achievement of planned sales revenue in the U.S, (ii)&nbsp;managing pricing strategies to deliver planned performance levels, (iii)&nbsp;developing and implementing strategies to maintain corporate account relationships,
	(iv)&nbsp;managing selling expenses, and (v)&nbsp;building leadership and talent in the sales organization.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	No specific weightings are
	attached to any of the foregoing factors, which serve as a general guide for the Committee in determining whether the individual goals for each NEO have been achieved.&nbsp;When considering the individual goal component of the annual performance
	objectives for our NEOs, the Committee also took into consideration the various factors that resulted in the Company restating its historical financial statements and delay in completing the fiscal 2015 audit.&nbsp;This included consideration of the
	performance of certain of our NEOs who assumed roles in helping to oversee the completion of the restatement and fiscal year 2015 audit and establishing and implementing a comprehensive remediation plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Funding Trigger
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Consistent with our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pay-for-performance
</FONT>
</FONT>
	compensation principle, the Cash Incentive Plan includes a funding trigger that requires the achievement of the established minimum threshold performance
	level for Adjusted EBITDA in order for any potential payout based on the Total Net Sales, Average Quarterly Debt Balance or Individual Goal Achievement measures. For fiscal year 2016, the Adjusted EBITDA funding trigger was set at
	$154.0&nbsp;million, the minimum Adjusted EBITDA threshold required to receive a threshold payout of 50% as described above. This requirement was met for the 2016 fiscal year.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	*
<I>
</I>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Target incentive award is based on Mr.
</I>
<I>
</I>
<I>
	&nbsp;Cottrill&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pro-rated
</FONT>
	annual salary from date of hire, November
</I>
<I>
</I>
<I>
	&nbsp;9, 2015, through
	March
</I>
<I>
</I>
<I>
	&nbsp;31, 2016.
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Long-Term Equity-Based Compensation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We maintain several equity-based incentive plans as described below under &#147;&#151;&nbsp;Equity-Base Incentive Plans&#148;, including:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the ADS Amended 2000 Incentive Stock Option Plan (or the 2000 Plan),
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the ADS 2008 Restricted Stock Plan (or the 2008 Plan), and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the ADS 2013 Stock Option Plan (or the 2013 Plan).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our NEOs participate in all of the
	aforementioned plans (except that Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty and Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill received no award grants under the 2000 Plan). We no longer make awards under the 2000 Plan. On August&nbsp;12, 2014, our board of directors amended the 2000 Plan to terminate
	the reload option feature under the 2000 Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Long-term equity incentive compensation is an integral part of the total compensation for
	Company executives and links pay to long-term performance. On an annual basis, the long-term equity-based incentives are reviewed versus the compensation peer group as well as the subjective assessment of each NEO&#146;s overall contribution to the
	business performance, strategic importance to our growth objectives, and individual performance and potential for future contributions.&nbsp;The Chief Executive Officer, with input from the human resources department, proposes long-term equity-based
	incentives, if any, for all NEOs, excluding himself, based on the aforementioned criteria. His proposal is subject to review and approval (with or without modifications) by the Committee. The long-term equity-based incentive grant, if any, for
	Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty is initiated and approved by the Committee directly, subject to the review and final approval of our board of directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	84
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage87"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297977D10KA_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In fiscal year 2016, no long-term incentive grants were initiated or approved, although the
	Company has committed to provide equity based awards of restricted stock and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-qualified
</FONT>
	stock options to certain key employees, including Scott Cottrill, the Company&#146;s Chief Financial Officer, as part
	of their appointment, with such grants to occur at a later date.&nbsp;This decision to not initiate a more broad-based grant of long term equity incentives in fiscal year 2016 was based on the scale of the stock option and restricted stock awards
	approved by the Committee and board of directors in fiscal year 2014 as part of a comprehensive review of our compensation programs and practices in light of our business model, growth strategy, and planned transition to public
	ownership.&nbsp;Following that review and discussion, the Committee approved changes to components of our executive compensation programs to establish a sustainable and competitive framework to motivate and retain the leadership talent necessary to
	drive achievement of planned business results as well as to guide the Company through the transition to being publicly owned.&nbsp;At that time, and consistent with those objectives, the Committee and board of directors approved
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-qualified
</FONT>
	stock option grants from the 2013 Plan that were intended to be multi-year awards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Benefits and
	Executive Perquisites
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The benefits provided to our NEOs are generally the same as those provided to our other salaried associates
	and include medical, vision and dental insurance, basic life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment insurance, short- and long-term disability insurance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All of the NEOs, with the exception of Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty, participate in our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	tax-qualified
</FONT>
	ESOP that
	covers employees who meet certain service requirements. See &#147;&#151;&nbsp;Equity-Based Incentive Plans &#151;&nbsp;Employee Stock Ownership Plan&#148; and &#147;Description of Employee Stock Ownership Plan&#148; for additional information
	regarding the ESOP.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All of the NEOs are provided with an individually owned life insurance policy providing $200,000 of permanent whole
	life coverage with a term rider providing an initial death benefit of $200,000. This benefit is in recognition of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	carve-out
</FONT>
	under our group term life insurance program that reduces the maximum benefit
	available from $450,000 to $50,000 for executives, including NEOs. The death benefit under the term rider is gradually replaced by
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	paid-up
</FONT>
	additional permanent life insurance provided by the dividends on the
	policies. The policies also accrue cash values which are owned by the executive, or their designee, and may be available to them while the policies are in effect. Premiums for each policy are paid for by us and the premium is considered taxable
	income to the NEO.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We also provide our NEOs with certain perquisites. These perquisites include use of Company-owned or leased cars and
	reimbursement of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	car-related
</FONT>
	expenses, payment of automobile insurance premiums for Company provided vehicles, and reimbursement of country club or fitness membership dues. In determining the total
	compensation payable to our NEOs, the Committee considers perquisites in the context of the total compensation which our NEOs are eligible to receive. However, given the fact that perquisites represent a relatively small portion of the NEO&#146;s
	total compensation, the availability of these perquisites does not materially influence the decisions made by the Committee with respect to other elements of the total compensation to which our NEOs are entitled or to which they are awarded.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The NEOs are also permitted to make
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-approved
</FONT>
	personal use of Company aircraft, subject to
	reimbursement to the Company of the aggregate cost of the aircraft for all (actual and ferry) flight hours associated with routine personal usage.&nbsp;Pursuant to the terms of his employment agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty is permitted to use Company
	aircraft for charitable and philanthropic uses which use is not subject to reimbursement and is reported in the &#147;All Other Compensation&#148; column of our Summary Compensation Table below.&nbsp;Otherwise Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty reimburses the
	Company for any routine personal use of Company aircraft. The incremental cost of personal use of Company aircraft is calculated based on the average variable operating cost per hour flown, which includes fuel costs, aircraft maintenance and
	supplies, landing fees and trip related hanger and parking costs. Fixed costs that do not change based on usage such as hangar rental, aircraft lease payments, insurance and certain administrative expenses are excluded from the incremental cost
	calculation. If an aircraft flies empty before picking up or after dropping off a passenger flying for personal reasons, this &#147;deadhead&#148; segment is included in the incremental cost of the personal use. If an NEO is traveling on business
	utilizing Company aircraft and there is otherwise room available on the aircraft for the NEO&#146;s spouse to accompany the NEO, the spouse is permitted to do so.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For a description of the perquisites received by our NEOs during fiscal year 2016, see the &#147;All Other Compensation&#148; column of our
	Summary Compensation Table below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	85
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297977D10KA_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Other Executive Compensation Policies and Practices
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Risk in Relation to Compensation Programs
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management has assessed our compensation programs and has concluded that there are no plans that provide meaningful incentives for employees,
	including our NEOs and additional executive officers, to take excessive risks that would be reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on us. The Company based its assessment on a review of the material compensation plans and arrangements,
	most notably the long-term equity based compensation programs and the annual cash incentive compensation plan. The Company reached its conclusion in part due to the balance of fixed and variable compensation, balance of short and long-term
	incentives, design features of the plans, and the oversight and administration of the Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Recoupment of Incentive Compensation Policy
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On June&nbsp;30, 2014 the board of directors adopted the
<I>
	Recoupment of Incentive Compensation
</I>
	policy to further protect the interests of
	the stockholders and Company. Under this policy, if, in the opinion of the independent directors of the board of directors, financial results are materially
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mis-stated
</FONT>
	due in whole or in part to intentional
	fraud or misconduct by one of more of the Company&#146;s executive officers, the independent directors have the discretion to use their best efforts to remedy the fraud or misconduct and prevent its recurrence. The independent directors may, for up
	to five years following such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mis-statement,
</FONT>
	direct that the Company recover all or a portion of any bonus or incentive compensation paid, or cancel the stock-based awards granted, to the executive officer(s).
	In addition, the independent directors may, for up to five years following such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mis-statement,
</FONT>
	also seek to recoup any gains realized with respect to equity-based awards, including stock options and restricted
	stock units.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The independent directors are entitled to exercise remedies pursuant to this policy if each of the following conditions have
	been met: (1)&nbsp;the bonus or incentive compensation to be recouped was calculated based upon the financial results that were restated, (2)&nbsp;one or more executive officers engaged in the intentional misconduct, and (3)&nbsp;the bonus or
	incentive compensation calculated under the restated financial results is less than amount actually paid or awarded.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	While the matters
	identified as part of the restatement of the Company&#146;s historical financial statements and completion of the fiscal year 2015 audit did not result in a finding of intentional fraud or misconduct that would trigger the above-referenced
	recoupment policy, in light of the uncertainty regarding the Company&#146;s final financial results for the fiscal
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	2015, the Committee elected to rescind the fiscal year 2015 awards and requested that
	the NEOs voluntarily return all previously-paid amounts.&nbsp;These bonus amounts were voluntarily returned by each NEO to the Company as reported in the Company&#146;s Current Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	8-K
</FONT>
	filed with
	the SEC on August&nbsp;17, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Tax and Accounting Considerations
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	While the accounting and tax treatment of compensation generally has not been a consideration in determining the amounts of compensation for
	our executive officers, the Committee and management have taken into account the accounting and tax impact of various program designs to balance the potential cost to us with the value to the executive.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The expenses associated with executive compensation issued to our executive officers and other key associates are reflected in our financial
	statements. We account for stock-based programs in accordance with the requirements of ASC Topic 718, which requires companies to recognize in the income statement the grant date value of equity-based compensation issued to associates over the
	vesting period of such awards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Compensation and Management Development Committee Report
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Compensation and Management Development Committee has reviewed and discussed with the Company&#146;s management the Compensation
	Discussion&nbsp;&amp; Analysis set forth above. Based on such review and discussions, the Compensation and Management Development Committee has recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion&nbsp;&amp; Analysis be included in
	this proxy statement and incorporated into the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K
</FONT>
	for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:65%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Respectfully submitted,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:65%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C. Robert Kidder (Chair)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:65%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Richard A. Rosenthal
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:65%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Abigail S. Wexner
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	86

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297977D10KA_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>

<EFX_COMPENSATION_TABLE>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Amounts reported for fiscal year 2016 reflect adjustment to NEO salaries that went into effect on May&nbsp;1, 2015. The amount reported for Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill reflects his salary from his start date of November&nbsp;9,
	2015. Amounts reported for fiscal year 2014 reflect adjustment to NEO salaries that went into effect as of September&nbsp;1, 2013.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	There were no restricted stock awards in fiscal years 2016 or 2015. Amounts reported for fiscal 2014 are based on the aggregate grant date fair value of restricted stock awarded, computed in accordance with FASB ASC
	Topic 718, Compensation &#151; Stock Compensation. We calculated the estimated fair value of each share of restricted stock on the date of grant as described in Note 18 (Stock-Based Compensation) in the audited financial statements included in the
	Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K/A
</FONT>
	for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The amounts reported in this column are based on the aggregate grant date fair value of stock options awarded, computed in accordance with FASB ASC Topic 718. We calculated the estimated fair value of each option award
	on the date of grant using a Black-Scholes option pricing model as described under as in Note 18 (Stock-Based Compensation) in the audited financial statements included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K/A
</FONT>
	for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. The amount in this column for Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon Mr.&nbsp;and Klein also includes the grant date fair value of reload options issued in connection with the
	exercise of previously granted options under the 2000 Plan. The dollar amount of the option awards in fiscal year 2014 and 2015 related to reload options for Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon is $50,791 and $83,506, respectively. The dollar amount of the option
	awards in fiscal year 2015 related to reload options for Mr.&nbsp;Klein is $187,272.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<A NAME="eolPage90"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297977D10KA_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	During fiscal 2016 we paid four quarterly cash dividends of $0.05 per share to all stockholders of record on June&nbsp;1, September&nbsp;1, December&nbsp;1 and March&nbsp;1, 2016. In connection with these dividends and
	based on their respective equity holdings, our NEOs received such dividend payments with respect to unvested shares of restricted common stock, which amounts are reflected in the &#147;All Other Compensation&#148; column.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The amounts shown in this column include the value of perquisites and other personal benefits to an NEO only if the aggregate value exceeded $10,000. Where we do report perquisites and other personal benefits for an
	NEO, we have separately quantified each perquisite or personal benefit only if it exceeds the greater of $25,000 or 10% of the total amount of perquisites and personal benefits for that individual. The amount reported for Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon includes
	(i) $4,868 for personal use of automobile and related automobile liability insurance expense, and (ii) $9,315 for reimbursement for social membership dues. The amount reported for Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill includes (i) $32,918 reimbursement for relocation
	expenses and temporary housing, and (ii)&nbsp;personal use of automobile and related automobile liability insurance expense, which amounts are not quantified since they do not exceed the greater of $25,000 or 10% of the total amount of
	Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill&#146;s perquisites and personal benefits. The amount reported for Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty includes (i) $110,152 of incremental cost to us of Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty&#146;s personal use of Company aircraft for charitable and philanthropic
	purposes (the incremental cost of personal use of Company aircraft is summarized above under &#147;Compensation Discussion and Analysis &#151; Benefits and Executive Perquisites&#148;), (ii) personal use of automobile and related automobile
	liability insurance expense, which amounts are not quantified since they do not exceed the greater of $25,000 or 10% of the total amount of Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty&#146;s perquisites and personal benefits, and (iii) $14,063 of reimbursement for social
	membership dues.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	(1)

	The amounts shown reflect the estimated payouts for fiscal year 2016 under the Cash Incentive Plan that the respective NEO would be eligible for assuming no use of discretion by the Committee in authorizing such
	payments. Actual amounts awarded are reflected in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Equity
</FONT>
	Incentive Plan Compensation column of the Summary Compensation Table above. For additional information, see discussion above under
	&#147;&#151;&nbsp;Compensation Discussion and Analysis &#151; Components of Compensation &#151; Annual Cash Incentive Compensation.&#148;
</TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill participated in the Cash Incentive Plan with an initial annual targeted cash bonus of 75% of his base salary and with prorated participation for fiscal year 2016 reflecting his start date of
	November&nbsp;9, 2015. Pursuant to the terms of his offer letter, Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill is entitled to receive equity based awards of restricted stock with a value of $300,000 and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-qualified
</FONT>
	stock options with
	a value of $500,000, subject to approval by the Company&#146;s Board of Directors, which awards will be made at a later date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The amounts shown are based on the aggregate grant date fair value of restricted stock and stock options awarded, computed in accordance with FASB ASC Topic 718. We calculated the estimated fair value of each option
	award on the date of grant using a Black-Scholes option pricing model, as described under &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations &#151; Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates &#151;
	Employee Benefit Plans &#151; Stock-Based Compensation Plans.&#148;
</TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Stock options issued pursuant to the 2013 Plan, which vest over a five-year period in 20% installments each year, beginning with the first anniversary following the grant date (except for Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty&#146;s option
	award, which vest over a four-year period in 25% installments each year). The vesting terms of these options did not accelerate upon completion of our IPO.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Stock options issued pursuant to the 2000 Plan, which vest over a three-year period in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-third
</FONT>
	installments each year, beginning with the fifth anniversary following the grant
	date, provided however that all then-remaining unvested options vested in full upon completion of our IPO.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Restricted stock issued pursuant to the 2008 Plan, which vest over a five-year period in 20% installments each year, beginning with the first anniversary following the grant date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The market value is the product of $21.30, the closing price of our common shares on the NYSE on March&nbsp;31, 2016, and the number of unvested stock awards.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill participated in the Cash Incentive Plan with an initial annual targeted cash bonus of 75% of his base salary and with prorated participation for fiscal year 2016. Pursuant to the terms of his offer
	letter, Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill is entitled to receive equity based awards of restricted stock with a value of $300,000 and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-qualified
</FONT>
	stock options with a value of $500,000, subject to approval by the
	Company&#146;s Board of Directors, which awards will be made at a later date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Amounts shown represent (i)&nbsp;with respect to option awards, the difference between the closing price of our common shares on the NYSE on the date of the options&#146; exercise and the option exercise price, and
	(ii)&nbsp;with respect to stock awards, the value of the restricted shares that vest based on the closing price of our common shares on the NYSE on the date (or the closing price of our common shares on the NYSE on the next business day in the event
	the NYSE was closed on the vesting date) the shares vested. The foregoing values do not necessarily equate to cash realized from the sale of shares acquired upon the exercise of options or vesting of restricted stock as shares were not sold on
	exercise or upon vesting, but continue to be held by the NEO.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Restricted stock vests over a five year period in 20% installments each year, beginning with the first anniversary following the grant date. The number of shares listed in this column reflects the total number of shares
	of restricted stock that vested during fiscal year 2016.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Pension Benefits and Nonqualified Deferred Compensation for Fiscal Year 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We do not provide any defined benefit plans or nonqualified deferred compensation plans to our NEOs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Employment Agreements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our NEOs have each
	entered into an amended and restated employment agreement with us, which were negotiated between each NEO and us at arms-length. Certain elements of the compensation payable to our NEOs are set forth in these employment agreements, including initial
	base salary (subject to periodic adjustment) and scope of incentive compensation and benefits. These employment agreements also require us to make certain payments upon termination or change in control, as set forth below in
	&#147;&#151;&nbsp;Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Joseph A. Chlapaty.
</I>
	On June&nbsp;20, 2014, we
	entered into an amended and restated employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty, our Chief Executive Officer. The employment agreement provides for an initial employment period ending March&nbsp;31, 2015. Beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2015 and each
	January&nbsp;1 thereafter, the then remaining term of the employment agreement will be extended automatically for an additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period until termination pursuant to its terms, including termination by
	either party through notice prior to the January&nbsp;1 renewal date. Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty&#146;s annual base salary for fiscal year 2016 was $550,000 and he is entitled to receive annual incentive compensation. The employment agreement also contains
	customary
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-competition
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-solicitation
</FONT>
	covenants of Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty that apply during his employment and within a period of two years following the termination
	of his employment with us and a confidentiality covenant of indefinite duration.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	90
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297977D10KA_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Scott A. Cottrill.
</I>
	On November&nbsp;9, 2015, we entered into an employment agreement with
	Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill, our Chief Financial Officer. The employment agreement provides for an initial employment period ending March&nbsp;31, 2018. Beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2018 and each January&nbsp;1 thereafter, the then remaining term of the
	employment agreement will be extended automatically for an additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period until termination pursuant to its terms, including termination by either party through notice prior to the January&nbsp;1
	renewal date. Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill&#146;s annual base salary for fiscal year 2016 was $455,000 and he is entitled to receive annual incentive compensation. The employment agreement also contains customary
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-competition
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-solicitation
</FONT>
	covenants of Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill that apply during his employment and within a period of two years following the termination of his
	employment with us and a confidentiality covenant of indefinite duration.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Mark B. Sturgeon.
</I>
	On June&nbsp;20, 2014, we entered into
	an amended and restated employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon, our former Chief Financial Officer. The employment agreement provided for an initial employment period ending March&nbsp;31, 2015. Beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2015 and each
	January&nbsp;1 thereafter, the then remaining term of the employment agreement extended automatically for an additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period until termination pursuant to its terms, including termination by either
	party through notice prior to the January&nbsp;1 renewal date. Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon&#146;s annual base salary for fiscal year 2016 was $320,000 and he was entitled to receive annual incentive compensation. The employment agreement also contained
	customary
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-competition
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-solicitation
</FONT>
	covenants of Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon that apply during his employment and within a period of two years following the termination
	of his employment with us. It also included a confidentiality covenant of indefinite duration. On November&nbsp;3, 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon notified the Company of his intention to retire from the Company effective March&nbsp;31, 2016 and effective
	November&nbsp;9, 2015 he stepped down as the Company&#146;s Chief Financial Officer, Secretary and Treasurer. Mr.&nbsp;Sturgeon remained employed as an Executive Vice President of the Company until his retirement on March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Thomas M. Fussner.
</I>
	On June&nbsp;20, 2014, we entered into an amended and restated employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Fussner, our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Co-Chief
</FONT>
	Operating Officer. The employment agreement provides for an initial employment period ending March&nbsp;31, 2015. Beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2015 and each January&nbsp;1 thereafter, the then remaining
	term of the employment agreement will be extended automatically for an additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period until termination pursuant to its terms, including termination by either party through notice prior to the
	January&nbsp;1 renewal date. Mr.&nbsp;Fussner&#146;s annual base salary for fiscal year 2016 was $335,000 and he is entitled to receive annual incentive compensation. The employment agreement also contains customary
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-competition
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-solicitation
</FONT>
	covenants of Mr.&nbsp;Fussner that apply during his employment and within a period of two years following the termination of his
	employment with us. It also includes a confidentiality covenant of indefinite duration.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Ronald R. Vitarelli.
</I>
	On June&nbsp;20,
	2014, we entered into an amended and restated employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Vitarelli, our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Co-Chief
</FONT>
	Operating Officer. The employment agreement provides for an initial employment period ending
	March&nbsp;31, 2017. Beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2017 and each January&nbsp;1 thereafter, the then remaining term of the employment agreement will be extended automatically for an additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period
	until termination pursuant to its terms, including termination by either party through notice prior to the January&nbsp;1 renewal date. Mr.&nbsp;Vitarelli&#146;s annual base salary for fiscal year 2016 was $310,000 and he is entitled to receive
	annual incentive compensation. The employment agreement also contains customary
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-competition
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-solicitation
</FONT>
	covenants of Mr.&nbsp;Vitarelli that apply during
	his employment and within a period of two years following the termination of his employment with us. It also includes a confidentiality covenant of indefinite duration.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Robert M. Klein.
</I>
	On June&nbsp;20, 2014, we entered into an amended and restated employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Klein, our Executive
	Vice President. The employment agreement provides for an initial employment period ending March&nbsp;31, 2015. Beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2015 and each January&nbsp;1 thereafter, the then remaining term of the employment agreement will be extended
	automatically for an additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period until termination pursuant to its terms, including termination by either party through notice prior to the January&nbsp;1 renewal date. Mr.&nbsp;Klein&#146;s
	annual base salary for fiscal year 2016 was $290,000 and he is entitled to receive annual incentive compensation. The employment agreement also contains customary
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-competition
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-solicitation
</FONT>
	covenants of Mr.&nbsp;Klein that apply during his employment and within a period of two years following the termination of his employment with us. It also includes a confidentiality covenant of
	indefinite duration.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have outstanding employment agreements with each of our NEOs as described above under &#147;&#151; Employment Agreements&#148; which require
	the payment of certain benefits to each NEO under certain specified circumstances, which we refer to as Specified Circumstances. Our employment agreements with each NEO identify the following as Specified Circumstances that would require the payment
	of certain benefits:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	termination by us at the end of the executive&#146;s initial employment period or renewal period by giving three-month notice,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	death or disability,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

	termination by the executive at the end of the executive&#146;s initial employment period or renewal period by giving three-month notice, if the executive will have attained the age of 65 years (or 68 years in the case
	of Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty) on the employment termination date,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	termination by the executive upon our breach of material covenant in the employment agreement and failure to cure after receiving notice of such breach,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	termination by the executive for good reason, which includes the following without the executive&#146;s consent: (i)&nbsp;a reduction in base salary; (ii)&nbsp;our action which would adversely affect the
	executive&#146;s participation in, or materially reduce his benefits under, any material benefit plan or equity incentive plan; (iii)&nbsp;our action which would adversely affect or reduce the executive&#146;s participation in, or materially reduces
	the maximum potential incentive compensation available to the executive under any of our material incentive compensation plan or program; (iv)&nbsp;the assignment of the executive to a position of a materially lesser status or degree of
	responsibility; or (v)&nbsp;the assignment of the executive to a primary work location (A)&nbsp;outside the United States or (B)&nbsp;at which (I)&nbsp;neither we nor our affiliates maintain a significant manufacturing facility or significant office
	or (II)&nbsp;by virtue of such location, the ability of the executive to perform his duties is materially impaired, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	termination by us for no reason or for any reason other than mutual agreement for termination or termination for cause. &#147;Cause&#148; includes the executive&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-performance
</FONT>
	of duties, failure to adhere to our policies, misappropriation of our property, conviction of felony or equivalent, or other crimes subject to possible imprisonment or involving theft,
	misappropriation, embezzlement, fraud or dishonesty.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event of termination as a result of the Specified Circumstances
	described above, each NEO shall be entitled to receive payments and benefits as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	for the 24 months (or 18 months in the case of Messrs. Vitarelli and Cottrill) following the termination date, we will continue to pay the executive&#146;s base salary, subject to reduction by the proceeds actually paid
	to the executive under any disability insurance policies maintained by us if the termination is due to the executive&#146;s disability,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	after the conclusion of our fiscal year in which the termination occurs, we will make a lump sum cash payment in an amount equal to the executive&#146;s accrued bonus for the prior fiscal year,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	after the conclusion of our first full fiscal year immediately following the conclusion of our fiscal year in which the termination occurs, we will pay the executive (except for Messrs. Vitarelli and Cottrill) a lump
	sum cash payment, which we refer to as the Termination Bonus I, as calculated under the applicable employment agreement, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	after the conclusion of our second full fiscal year immediately following the conclusion of our fiscal year in which the termination occurs, we will pay the executive (except for Messrs. Vitarelli and Cottrill) a lump
	sum cash payment, which we refer to as the Termination Bonus II, as calculated under the applicable employment agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The payment of the above 24 (or 18) months base salary, Termination Bonus I and Termination Bonus II is conditioned upon the executive&#146;s
	release of claims against us.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the executive terminates employment with us at the end of his initial employment period or renewal
	period by giving three-month notice, but the executive will not have attained the age of 65 years (or 68 years in the case of Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty) on the employment termination date, then after the conclusion of the fiscal year in which the
	termination occurs, we will pay to the executive a lump sum cash payment in an amount equal to the accrued bonus for this fiscal year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Except in the case of Mr.&nbsp;Cottrill, the employment agreements also provide that, notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any equity
	incentive plan or related agreements, if the executive&#146;s employment is terminated by us for any reason other than for cause, all unvested restricted shares under the 2008 Plan and all unvested options under the 2000 Plan or the 2013 Plan (or
	only the restricted shares under the 2008 Plan or the options under the 2013 Plan in the case of Mr.&nbsp;Chlapaty) awarded to the executive will fully vest at the employment termination date. Such vested options will be exercisable during the 90
	consecutive day period immediately following the employment termination date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our stock option agreements with each NEO under the 2000
	Plan and the 2013 Plan provide that (i)&nbsp;upon death or disability of the executive, all the options may be exercised during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period commencing on the date of the executive&#146;s death or
	disability and (ii)&nbsp;upon termination of employment of the executive for any reason other than for death, disability or for cause, all the options may be exercised during the three-month period commencing on the employment termination date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Change in Control.
</I>
	Under the 2000 Plan, our stock option agreements with the executives provide that all the options may be exercised
	by the executives commencing at the time of a &#147;change in control.&#148; A &#147;change in control&#148; for this purpose refers to: (i)&nbsp;our entry into an agreement to merge, consolidate or reorganize into or with another corporation or
	other legal person, and as a result less than 51% of the combined voting power of the then-outstanding securities of such corporation or person immediately after such
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	92
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297977D10KA_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	transaction will be held in the aggregate by officers, directors and holders of a beneficial interest in our voting securities immediately prior to such transaction; (ii)&nbsp;our entry into an
	agreement to sell or otherwise transfer all or substantially all of its assets to any other corporation or other legal person, and as a result a beneficial interest in less than 51% of the combined voting power of the then-outstanding securities of
	such corporation or person immediately after such sale or transfer is held in the aggregate by officers, directors and holders of a beneficial interest in our voting securities immediately prior to such sale or transfer; or (iii)&nbsp;during any
	continuous
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period our stockholders&#146; sale of or entry into an agreement or agreements to sell to anyone other than us our securities representing 50% or more of our combined voting power at the
	beginning of such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the 2008 Plan, our restricted stock agreements with the
	executives provide that the restricted shares will vest effective at the time of a &#147;change in control.&#148; A &#147;change in control&#148; for this purpose refers to the occurrence of a transaction or series of transactions following which
	less than a majority of the voting power of us a successor entity is held by the persons who hold the same with respect to us immediately prior to such transaction or series of transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the 2013 Plan, our stock option agreements with the executives provide that all the options may be exercised by the executives
	commencing at the time of a &#147;change in control.&#148; A &#147;change in control&#148; for this purpose refers to the occurrence of a transaction or series of transactions following which less than a majority of the voting power of us a
	successor entity is held by the persons who hold the same with respect to us immediately prior to such transaction or series of transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Potential Payment
</I>
	. The following table sets forth the payments and benefits that would be received by each NEO in the event a
	termination of employment or a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	change-in-control
</FONT>
</FONT>
	of the Company had occurred on March&nbsp;31, 2016, over and above any payments or benefits he otherwise would already
	have been entitled to or vested in on such date under any employment contract or other plan of the Company. The NEO would receive other payments and benefits as well upon termination of employment to which they were already entitled or vested in on
	such date. The actual amounts to be paid can only be determined at the time of such NEO&#146;s separation from us and could therefore be more or less than the amounts set forth below. For the purposes of the calculations in the table, payments that
	would be made over time have been presented as a lump sum value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
